results.name: The Collatz or 3x+1 map (A006370) conjugated by unary-binary-encoding (A156552).
comment: Collatz-conjecture can be formulated via this sequence by postulating that all iterations of a(n), starting from any n > 1, will eventually reach the cycle [2, 5, 3].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
formula: If n is odd, then a(n) = A064989(n), otherwise a(n) = A329603(n) = A341510(n,2*n).
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
